title: NFDI-MatWerk/IUC02 Data schema for creep data of Ni-base superalloys including a comprehensive documentation of test results and metadata
description: JSON Schema for the NFDI-MatWerk IUC02. (DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.11668376)

enum: Uninterrupted creep tests with continuous monitoring of extension
Interrupted creep tests with periodic measurement of elongation
Stress rupture tests where normally only the time to fracture is measured

endOfTestCriteriumValue.description: End of test criterium - value (if not test piece break)

enum: induction melting in air, casting into a circular ingot and then electroslag remelting

chemicalCompositionNominal.description: (Link to) File, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data or the possibility of adding the wt.-% value of each element in individual fields.

chemicalCompositionMeasured.description: (Link to) File, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data or the possibility of adding the wt.-% value of each element in individual fields.

dissolvedGammaRegions.description: completely dissolved and re-precipitated gamma-gamma' regions

singleCrystalOrientationDeterminationMet.description: Single crystal orientation determination method-measuring point

crackInspection.description: Crack Inspection: e.g., Penetrant certification/Radiographic certification/XCT. (Link to) File, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data.

proofStrengthCreepTestTemperature.description: 0.2 % Proof strength at creep test temperature.

testPieceLocation.description: Location of the test piece within the as-tested material. (Link to) File, preferably with machine-readable (meta)data.

positioning.description: (Laue, precision) Description whether coordinate systems of as-tested material and test piece coincide, and of the alignment in the test machine.

testFrameVerification.description: Verification of Test Frame and Specimen Alignment according to ASTM E1012?

descriptionTestFrameVerification.description: Please provide a description on the procedure followed for the Verification of Test Frame and Specimen Alignment if different from ASTM E1012.

dataAcquisitionTimeCheck.description: Was the time checked during data acquisition?

caliberatedWeightsApplied.description: Were calibrated weights used to apply the test force?

loadSensorUsed.description: Was the load sensor used during loading?

caliberationTestForce.description: Has a calibration of the test force data acquisition been performed?

roomTemperature.description: Was the room temperature recorded and checked?

humidityCheck.description: Was the humidity recorded and checked?

sampleControl.description: Control via thermocouples on sample/via furnace

metrologicalTraceability.description: Metrological traceability (Yes, if Sensor AND Data acquisition checked)

gaugeSectionLocation.description: Application: location with respect to gauge section

dataAcquisitionUnitCaliberated.description: Is/are the data acquisition unit calibrated?

measurementAction.description: Is measurement axial or diametrical action?

enum: at test piece in parallel length

extensometerCaliberation.description: Is extensometer incl. the data acquisition calibrated?

dataDescription.description: Description of primary and processed data series-  Primary data is data that is directly acquired by sensors or measuring instruments during or after a test. Processed data is obtained as a result of using procedures (equations, algorithms, methods, unit conversions) to transform data.

dataProcessingDescription.description: Description of primary data series processing (incl. averaging, smoothing)

dataAnalysisDescription.description: Description of the data processing and analysis procedures used to obtain specific test results, e.g. percentage elastic extension, $e_{e}$

software.description: Software, if applicable, including product and version

referenceLengthToCalculatePercentageElon.description: Reference length for calculation of percentage elongations if $L_{o}$ and/or extensometer $L_{e}$ are outside the parallel length. Symbol usually indicated as $L_{r}$, if $L_{r}$ > $L_{c}$

referenceLengthToCalculatePercentageExte.description: Reference length for calculation of percentage extensions. Symbol usually indicated as $L_{r}$ = $L_{o}$

ratioLrD.description: Ratio $L_{r}$ / D ; (if $L_{r}$ = $L_{o}$). Symbol usually indicated as $L_{r}$/D; (if $L_{r}$ = $L_{o}$)

kValueLr.description: k-value for $L_{r}$ ; (if $L_{r}$ = $L_{o}$). Symbol usually indicated as $L_{r}$ / square root of $S_{o}$; (if $L_{r}$ = $L_{o}$)

ratioLrD1.description: Ratio $L_{r}$ / D ; (if $L_{r}$ > $L_{c}$). Symbol usually indicated as $L_{r}$/D; (if $L_{r}$ > $L_{c}$)

kValueLr1.description: k-value for $L_{r}$ ; (if $L_{r}$ > $L_{c}$). Symbol usually indicated as $L_{r}$ / square root of $S_{o}$; (if $L_{r}$ > $L_{c}$)

ratioLrD2.description: Ratio $L_{r}$ / D ; (if $L_{r}$ = $L_{e}$). Symbol usually indicated as $L_{r}$/D; (if $L_{r}$ = $L_{e}$)

kValueLr2.description: k-value for $L_{r}$ ; (if $L_{r}$ = $L_{e}$). Symbol usually indicated as $L_{r}$ / square root of $S_{o}$; (if $L_{r}$ = $L_{e}$)

enum: At the edge of the upper/lower extensometer gauge length/parallel length
Outside the extensometer gauge length/parallel length

percentagePlasticExtension.description: Percentage plastoc extension from end of loading. Symbol usually indicated as e

percentageReduction.description: Percentage reduction of area after creep fracture. Symbol usually indicated as $Z_{u})$

averagingValue.description: Was there an averaging of the strain/distance values? (two-sided extensometer)
